title: Rate of Change - linear function table

content.question:
<math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>
<math alttext="negative 3"><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></math>
<math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math>
<math alttext="6"><mn>6</mn></math>
<math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>
<math alttext="negative 10"><mo>-</mo><mn>10</mn></math>
<math alttext="negative 2"><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math>
<math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>

​The table gives values of the function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> for selected values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>. If the function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is linear, what is the value of <math alttext="f open parentheses 13 close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mn>13</mn></mfenced></math> ?

topic.text: 1.3: Rates of Change in Linear and Quadratic Functions

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
